persons.name: Pierre-SimonLaplace
persons.description: French mathematician seen as the Newton of France. He met Davy in 1813 and 1820. ForMemRSL.

places.name: Northern Ireland
places.description: Northern Ireland consists of six counties to the north-east of the island, not including the Republic of Ireland county, Donegal, to the west.

places.name: Derbyshire
places.description: Derbyshire is a county in the East Midlands and includes part of the Peak District.

places.name: Land's End
places.description: Land's End is a headland on the west coast of Cornwall. It is the most westerly point of mainland England. The underlying rock at Land's End is granite.

places.name: Mam Tor
places.description: A hill near Castleton in the High Peak of Derbyshire, England.

places.name: Cornwall
places.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

places.name: Lizard Point
places.description: The Lizard is a peninsula of the southern coast of Cornwall. It is the most southerly point of the British mainland. The geology of the Lizard is complex: it contains some of Cornwall's oldest (Precambrian) rocks, as well as heavily metamorphosed rocks.

places.name: Cape Cornwall
places.description: Cape Cornwall is a headland north of Land's End.

places.name: Cader Idris
places.description: Cader Idris is a mountain in Merionnydd, near Dolgellau, Wales.

places.name: North Wales
places.description: A geographic region of Wales.

places.name: Donegal
places.description: Donegal is a town at the mouth of the River Eske, in north-west Ireland.

places.name: Anglesey
places.description: Anglesey is an island, and county, on the north-west coast of Wales.

places.name: Cornwall
places.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

places.name: Fingal's Cave
places.description: a sea cave on the uninhabited island of Staffa, in the Inner Hebrides of Scotland, known for its natural acoustics.

places.name: Giant's Causeway
places.description: The Giant's Causeway is an extensive area of columnar basalt in County Antrim, Northern Ireland, formed by an ancient volcanic fissure eruption.

places.name: Binevenagh
places.description: Binevenagh is a large, steep-sided hill in County Londonderry, Northern Ireland.

places.name: Morton
places.description: A castle located by an artificial loch in the hills above Nithsdale, in Dumfries and Galloway, south-west Scotland.

places.name: Pleaskin Cliff
places.description: Pleaskin Head is a cliff that is part of the Giant's Causeway coastline, Northern Ireland.

places.name: Fairhead
places.description: Fairhead is a spectacular 5km long, 82m high cliff above the sea at Ballycastle, County Antrim, Northern Ireland. It is a dolerite sill.

places.name: Cornwall
places.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

places.name: Dorset
places.description: A county in southwest England. It’s known for the Jurassic Coast, a long stretch on the English Channel where the cliffs contain many fossils, and rock formations show millions of years of geological history.

places.name: Devon
places.description: A county in south-west England.

places.name: Darling Downs
places.description: The South Downs are a range of chalk hills extending from Hampshire to Sussex.

places.name: Wiltshire
places.description: A county in south-western England. The county town is Trowbridge.

places.name: Derbyshire
places.description: Derbyshire is a county in the East Midlands and includes part of the Peak District.

places.name: Sussex
places.description: A county in southern England.

places.name: Berkshire
places.description: Berkshire is a county in south-east England.

places.name: Darling Downs
places.description: The South Downs are a range of chalk hills extending from Hampshire to Sussex.

places.name: Norfolk
places.description: A county in the east of England. The largest settlement is Norwich.

places.name: Cambridgeshire
places.description: A ceremonial county in the East of England and East Anglia.

places.name: Bagshot Heath
places.description: An area of wet and dry heath, bog, and unimproved grassland in Surrey, England.

places.name: River Arveyron
places.description: Davy is possibly referring to the rivers Arveyron and Arve: the Arveyron rises just above Chamonix in France and is a tributary of the Arve.

places.name: Rhone River
places.description: A major river in France and Switzerland.

places.name: Lake Geneva
places.description: Lake Geneva is the largest body of water in Switzerland.

places.name: Cumberland
places.description: Cumberland is a historic county in the far north-west of England.

places.name: Snowdonia
places.description: Snowdonia is a mountainous region of north Wales.

places.name: Derwentwater
places.description: A lake in the Lake District in North West England, immediately south of Keswick.

places.name: Borrowdale
places.description: A valley and civil parish in the English Lake District in Cumberland, England.

places.name: Capel Curig
places.description: Capel Curig is a village in Caernarfonshire, in the heart of Snowdonia.

places.name: Bassenthwaite lake
places.description: A body of water in the Lake District in North West England, near the town of Keswick.

places.name: Lodore falls
places.description: A waterfall in Cumbria, England, close to Derwentwater and downstream from Watendlath.

places.name: Yr Wyddfa
places.description: Also known as Snowdon. The highest mountain peak in Wales.

places.name: North Wales
places.description: A geographic region of Wales.

places.name: Ganges
places.description: The Ganges is a river in Asia running through India and Bangladesh. It is part of the third largest river on earth.

places.name: Loch Lomond
places.description: Loch Lomond is a Scottish fresh water loch which crosses the Highland Boundary Fault.

places.name: Loch Awe
places.description: A large body of freshwater in Argyll and Bute, Scottish Highlands.

places.name: Lochleven
places.description: Loch Leven is the largest, lowland, freshwater lake in Scotland. Loch Leven trout are red in colour.

persons.name: Georges-Louis Leclerc, Comte deBuffon
persons.description: French naturalist, mathematician and cosmologist. His Histoire Naturelle, published in 1789, ran to 37 volumes. ForMemRSL.

persons.name: JamesHutton
persons.description: Scottish geologist, agriculturalist and chemical manufacturer. His Theory of the Earth (1795) is one of the foundations of modern geology. Davy discussed Hutton's theories in his lectures and visited some of the key geological sites that Hutton used in his work.

places.name: Plynlimon
places.description: The highest point of the Cambrian Mountains in Wales.

places.name: Devil's Bridge, Ceredigion
places.description: A village and community in Ceredigion, Wales. Above the River Mynach on the edge of the village is a series of three stacked bridges, constructed hundreds of years apart, from which the village gets its English name.

places.name: Hafod
places.description: Hafod is a district of the city of Swansea, south Wales, and lies within the Landore ward. Hafod is home to the now-closed Hafod Copperworks, founded in 1810.

places.name: Ceredigion
places.description: a county in the west of Wales.

places.name: Monarch
places.description: A rivulet near Cardiganshire, rising under Plynlimon, and running about six miles south-west to the Rheidiol, near Devil's Bridge.

places.name: Afon Rheidol
places.description: A river in Ceredigion, Wales.

places.name: London
places.description: The capital city of England and the United Kingdom.

places.name: Santa Fe
places.description: New Mexico’s capital, sits in the Sangre de Cristo foothills.

places.name: River Thames
places.description: The River Thames, known alternatively in parts as the River Isis, is a river that flows through southern England including London.

places.name: Bogotá
places.description: The capital of Colombia.

places.name: Tequendama Falls
places.description: The Tequendama Falls is a waterfall of the Bogotá River, Colombia.

places.name: United States
places.description: The U.S. is a country of 50 states covering a vast swath of North America, with Alaska in the northwest and Hawaii extending the nation’s presence into the Pacific Ocean.

places.name: Seine River
places.description: A river in northern France. Its drainage basin is in the Paris Basin covering most of northern France.

places.name: Bogotá river
places.description: A major river of the Cundinamarca department of Colombia.

places.name: Alps
places.description: The Alps are the highest and most extensive mountain range that lies entirely in Europe. They are located in eight European countries.

places.name: Magdalena River Valley
places.description: A valley in Colombia located within the Colombian Andes. The valley is specifically situated between the Central and Eastern Ranges and crossed by the river of the same name, the Magdalena River.

places.name: Pacific Ocean
places.description: The largest and deepest of Earth's five oceans.
